intro: Aceras anthropophorum f. angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, with a distinctive white, fluffy appearance on the flowers. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
